column5:
The #DavosAgenda has given us detailed insights into the state of the world in 2022. A personal highlight was Ursula @vonderleyen's special address on the importance of restoring trust in government and between world leaders.
Watch more here: https://t.co/UgtjYoEnQ7 https://t.co/ZXxj1jmlvz
The @wef’s Forum #COP26 Live programme begins today. Find out more about our sessions and speakers here: https://t.co/mpIjNGFzKN

Ahead of #COP26, more than 90 CEOs of global organizations are committed to reduce emissions by more than 1Gt* annually by 2030 and believe that businesses can do more if world leaders set a target that keeps 1.5C in reach.

Read the letter here: https://t.co/iM3i5rQnTv

It was a pleasure to discuss and reflect with @CourtneyFingar on the ways we can achieve a more inclusive and environmental global economy. What encourages me, is that Stakeholder capitalism is not a fiction, it is already practiced by some companies in a real way.
Enjoyed this conversation with @BadrJafar discussing #philanthropy and our outlook for the sector. Thank you @CambridgeCSP for hosting. https://t.co/6ooCWN9LTT

“Rebuilding a better, post-Covid-19 world with a new mindset of stakeholders”. Thank you ⁦@theSTeditor⁩ and ⁦@ShefaliRekhi⁩ for this wide-ranging interview on Stakeholder Capitalism, Singapore, & our Special Annual Meeting in ⁦@straits_times https://t.co/aE0Q7Q77BF

"Radio Davos” addresses many of the important issues we discuss this week during #DavosAgenda, such as ESG, climate change, and stakeholder capitalism. 

Listen to it here: https://t.co/OQCfpL1UBz @wef https://t.co/fciuocA0l2
The @wef's #DavosAgenda begins today. Join in to hear from government, business and civil society leaders in over 130 sessions: https://t.co/qYIC4ceKVB https://t.co/jAN4raCOtH
